clinical_study.brief_title: Phase II Study of Sorafenib + Carboplatin and Docetaxel in First Line Treatment of Stage IIIB/IV Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study of Sorafenib in Combination With Carboplatin and Docetaxel in the First Line Treatment of Stage IIIB/IV Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

clinical_study.source: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, single institution, phase II study of Sorafenib in combination with docetaxel and carboplatin in patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer. Docetaxel and carboplatin will be given on day 1 of every three week cycle. Patients will take Sorafenib twice a day on the 1st day of treatment and continue to take the medication every day until progression of disease, prohibitive toxicity, or patient withdrawal from the study. Chemotherapy courses will repeat every 21 days in the absence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity for a total of four cycles.

primary_outcome.measure: Estimate the objective response rate of patients with Stage IIIB/IV NSCLC receiving the combination therapy of Sorafenib and docetaxel/carboplatin
primary_outcome.time_frame: Analysis occurs once last patient completes chemotherapy

secondary_outcome.measure: To estimate the progression-free survival (PFS) and overall survival for all patients
To evaluate the toxicities of Sorafenib in patients with advanced and metastatic NSCLC
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once the last patient has completed chemotherapy

secondary_outcome.measure: To measure surrogate biomarkers of Sorafenib activity and toxicity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once the last patient has completed chemotherapy

arm_group.description: 400 mg po BID Sorafenib + 75 mg/m2 IV Docetaxel on day 1 plus AUC 6 on Carboplatin on day 1 of each 21 day cycle

intervention.description: 400 mg po BID Sorafenib + 75 mg/m2 IV Docetaxel on day 1 plus AUC 6 on Carboplatin on day 1 of each 21 day cycle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed NSCLC with clinical or radiological evidence of advanced disease (Stage IIIB/IV)
- Uni-dimensionally measurable disease
- Age => 18 years
- ECOG performance status of 0-1
- Life expectancy > 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Small-cell or mixed histologies including a small cell component
- Prior chemotherapy, biotherapy, radiotherapy to an area of measurable disease
- Patients with peripheral neuropathy grade => 2
